title: Balance is not updated after sending / receiving transaction and sometimes no transaction is shown in transaction history (for new accounts)
body:
# Bug Report

## Problem
The balance on multi-account and individual account view is not updated after sending or receiving transaction until relogin.
Reproduced only on IOS 13.
UPD: it is not only IOS issue. Has been noticed with Androids too. 

#### Expected behavior
Balance is updated

#### Actual behavior
Balance is not updated 

### Reproduction

[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status
- Restore account with funds (tested on Ropsten network)
- Send some asset to another user (confirmed on tokens and ETHro)
- Wait until the transaction is confirmed on etherscan 
- Wait ~5 min more

### Additional Information
- Status version: nightly 30/10/2019
- Operating System: iOS 13 

#### Logs

I can't fetch logs for IOS13, but the issue is reproduced constantly.
cc @rachelhamlin - `v1 release` scope from my POV

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done

UPD: seems it is not only IOS issue.
The same issue is reproducing on Android sometimes (testing only on new accounts).
Steps:
- create account
- request ETHro and STT from faucet
- send some STT to another account

So:
1) balance is not updated during > 10 mins
2) no transactions fetched.


Reproduced ~5 time in a row.
Example of transaction (Ropsten): 0xd28cdefa3e742f639233629b663662ce540f665d039d2cea274382fb816a3aed 
Full logcat: 
[logcat_tr.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/files/3790154/logcat_tr.log)

Can be related to #9203
More logs / video for no transaction in history: https://app.saucelabs.com/tests/305bd602fd1b46f1ac53adc2af11294b?auth=241e576dcd6e709499b2898335a9aad6#96

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. **Started** 3. Submitted 4. Done

Please review their action plans below:

I will determine why the balance on accounts does not update on iOS 13.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/9361/3612).

Reproduced yesterday on nightly, Mainnet (0.14.0 (2019102802)) on Android Galaxy s10e. It easily took >30' before I could see the transaction. Could have solved by relogin, not 100% sure.

To add: Token balance is also not up to date after relaunch and login 1 day later. Eth amount is valid, but token balance shows 0 while it's not. cc @churik have you seen that on other devices as well?

Hey there @igetgames - how's this one going for you? It's blocking our test team on something and I also realize it may not be straightforward to fix. Might have one contributors take it off you if you're finding it challenging. Let me know what you think.

Hi @rachelhamlin. I've been digging into this and see the issue possibly happening in either of a couple cases:

* `status-go` is not firing the `"wallet" "newblock"` event for new accounts, which is required to update the balances when transactions are updated
* `status-go` is firing the `"wallet" "history"` event for new accounts, which would not update the balances, even though transactions are updated

I've also referred to #9157 (which fixed #8951) because the only other instances where the balance is updated outside of `status-go` firing events are when the wallet is initialized, an account is created, or when the network status changes from offline to online (and the number of accounts has changed).

I'm close to finding the case, I should be able to report back tomorrow or have a PR queued if it's the issue is in the client. If the issue is on the `status-go` side then it's out of my depth.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11790366/68388862-e265cf80-0161-11ea-8235-5ecd6019c2cf.png)
thanks @igetgames , i also think the issue probably on status-go side, and I created the issue https://github.com/status-im/status-go/issues/1665
Thanks so much for your research here @igetgames - I will pay out the partial bounty to thank you for your investigation. Are you also at work on #8837?
Yep, I’m also working on #8837 and should have it completed this weekend. Thanks!
Okay, awesome. Thanks for the update!
